def tap_and_copy_internal_user_id(driver, x, y):
    """Tap on the exact coordinates and retrieve the internal user ID from clipboard."""
    tap_x29, tap_y29 = 100, 100
    driver.tap([(tap_x29, tap_y29)])
    print("Profile tapped")
    time.sleep(10)
    
    tap_x30, tap_y30 = 640, 414
    driver.tap([(tap_x30, tap_y30)])
    print("ID copied")
    time.sleep(5)

    internal_user_id = pyperclip.paste()
    print(f"Clipboard Content: {internal_user_id}")  # Log the clipboard content

    # Validate if the clipboard contains valid data (internal user ID)
    if internal_user_id and internal_user_id.strip():
        print(f"Internal User ID copied: {internal_user_id}")
        save_internal_user_id(internal_user_id)  # Now properly indented
        
    else:
        print("No valid internal user ID found in the clipboard. Make sure the app is copying the correct data.")
